result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason M. Fields was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).
  • Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.82(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: **02-14-2016 - Court amends judgment to add credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
State has 30 days to submit a claim for restitution.  While on extended supervision, the defendant is to pay $4000.00 toward restitution ($2000.00 during the first 6 months and $2000.00 during the remainder of the year).

**02-21-2017 - Court sets restitution per stipulation of the parties.

The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  The Defendant is to abide by all rules and conditions of the Agent.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  The Defendant is not to possess any controlled substances.  The Defendant is to obtain and maintain full time employment and/or educational programming as recommended.  The Defendant is to have no contact with JD.  The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis, unless already provided.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.
